dogFacts.text: Dogs are descendants of wolves and have been domesticated for thousands of years.
Dogs come in a wide range of sizes, from small toy breeds to large working breeds.
Dogs have a keen sense of smell, which is about 1,000 times more sensitive than a human's.
Dogs have different coat types, including short hair, long hair, and hairless.
Dogs have been trained for various tasks such as hunting, herding, protection, and companionship.
Dogs have the ability to understand and respond to human emotions and commands.
Dogs have a unique relationship with humans, as they are the only animal that has evolved to read and respond to human emotions.
